body.value: Unknown introducer makes an announcement about the room.
Unknown introducer continues to make announcements.
Margaret Atwood talks about room set up, it is recorded by the mic
Audience responds, says they want to stay in the same room.
Margaret Atwood tries to arrange people in the room.
Margaret Atwood continues to arrange audience.
The Animals in that Country (Oxford University Press, 1968)
taught at Sir George Williams University between 1967-68
Margaret Atwood introduces “Newsreel, Man and Firing Squad”.
reading entirely from You are Happy (Harper & Row, 1974)
what it’s like to live in Canada
from You Are Happy (Oxford University Press, 1974)
from You Are Happy (Oxford University Press, 1974)
from You Are Happy (Oxford University Press,     1974)
from You Are Happy (Oxford University Press, 1974)
Reads unknown poem, first line “You take my hand and I’m suddenly in a bad movie...”.
war between Superman and Captain Marvel
Introduces “Circe/Mud Poems”, which is cut mid-sentence “The heads of eagles no longer interest me...”
Recording is CUT, repeats, begins mid-sentence reading unknown poem, which is cut mid-sentence “The heads of eagles no longer interest me...”, last line “They would rather be trees”.
Introduces “There is Only One of Everything”.
Reads “There is Only One of Everything”.
from You are Happy (Oxford University Press, 1974)
Wynne Francis thanks Margaret Atwood and opens the floor to discussion.
Audience #1 (female) asks first question about Atwood’s nickname ‘witch’.
Audience #2 (male) asks question about the Edible Woman’s symbology of colours.
Audience #3 (male) asks question about a screenplay.
Audience #4 (female) asks question about film producers’ nationalities.
attempt to sell script in Canada
four or five screen plays which haven’t been made
Wynne Francis asks a question about criticism.
ideal critic or ideal type of criticism
Audience Member #5 (male) asks question about body and knowledge.
Margaret Atwood calls on audience member to ask question.
Audience #6 (male) asks question about Quebec’s relation to Canada.
Audience #6 (male) asks question about Quebecer’s relation to Canada.
Audience #7 (female) asks question about the New Canadian Library Series.
opinion of the New Canadian Library Series introductions
quotation from the Joy of Cooking
Audience #8 (female) asks question about one line of Atwood’s poem.
Audience #9 (female) asks question about a second Survival book.
Audience #10 (male) asks question about favourite poets.
Margaret Atwood responds to inaudible question.
Audience #11 (female) asks question about Surfacing being autobiographical.
Audience #13 (male) asks question about Edible Woman.
Audience #13 (male) asks question about the definition of comedy.
Audience #14 (male) asks question about latest writing.
Audience #15 (female) asks question about Edible Woman
Audience #15 (female) asks about selections in Survival.
Audience #16 (female) asks question about No Man by Gwendolyn MacEwen.
Audience #17 (male) asks question about selections made in Atwood’s reading
